title: Add `Remove` button to `Track distance` > `Map` flow on web and mobile

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Improvement
labels.description: Item broken or needs improvement.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
## Background Coming from [this convo](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07HPDRELLD/p1768875279554969), we'd like to add a `Remove` button to the `Track distance` > `Map` flow, specifically on the page where you enter an individual address. Both on web and mobile. ## Details This is exactly where we want to add the `Remove` button, on the second screen below: cc @Expensify/design
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @bernhardoj

Navigate to https://staging.new.expensify.com/ or launch Expensify App 2. Log in with valid credentials 3. Ensure that you have a group chat with at least 2 people 4. Open the global search and begin searching using 2 any keywords from those users (example: accounts, names) ## Expected Result: The search displays the group and does not show DMs. ## Actual Result: The search doesn't display the group and shows DMs. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ec2f0faa-2251-4eea-b1a0-1ea637d8e946 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.6-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/78358 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** agexptest+pr210126@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution **Device used:** Windows 11/ Chrome, Samsung S23FE/ Android 16, iPhone 13 Mini/ iOS 26.1 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Prerequisites: Have two workspaces with taxes enabled. One of them is the default workspace. Add a new tax rate to the default workspace. 1. Launch the Expensify app 2. Go to selfDM 3. Create a new tracked expense 4. Set the tax rate to the newly created one 5. Tap on Submit to someone 6. Choose a different workspace with tax enabled 7. Fill in the merchant if needed 8. Tap on "Create X expense" 9. Verify that you see the error for the tax rate 10. Change the tax rate 11. Verify that after changing the tax rate no error appears and you can submit the expense ## Expected Result: The error message disappears, and the expense is successfully created. ## Actual Result: Unable to create an expense due to the error message. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ccfe979c-3a5a-49e4-b2eb-bb03325e8b81 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.6-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Unable to validate in Prod - Provide reasoning. **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-3235/folder/31025987/72292684/1141127464?sort=-identifier **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** admin@expplause.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Macbook Pro 2023 / Sequoia 15.2 **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: Precond: User is signed into admin@expplause.com account 1. Access www.staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to WS > Verified Domain > Domain Admins 3. Add any admin 4. Go Offline and select and revoke this admin 5. While offline go to Settings > Primary Contact and select the revoked admins name 6. Go back online ## Expected Result: User should not see the revoked admins name ## Actual Result: The revoked admins name can be seen and even selected, it will briefly show even after returning online ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25456589-8dba-4785-9f6d-ac8a14ba9888 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.6-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/78889 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+sdjois2jd@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** iPhone 15 Pro Max / iOS 26.1 **App Component:** Search ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Log in to Expensifail account or account with many contacts. 1. Launch Expensify app. 2. Open FAB > Create expense > Manual. 3. Enter amount > Next. 4. On confirm page, tap To field. 5. Scroll to the bottom. ## Expected Result: Contact list will always auto load when scrolled to the bottom. ## Actual Result: Contact list does not auto load unless scrolled up. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/82ed8559-47f8-46af-8b49-db7f210680a3 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
